instructions: Image titled Check if an iPhone Is Stolen Step 1 1 Open your iPhone s settings. From the Springboard screen of your iPhone, tap the app with a gear icon labeled Settings to view your iPhone s customizable options. Image titled Check if an iPhone Is Stolen Step 2 2 View your device s information. Scroll down the Settings and tap the General options. Image titled Check if an iPhone Is Stolen Step 3 3 Select About from the General settings list, and you should see all the information about your iPhone such as its software version, serial number, and more. Image titled Check if an iPhone Is Stolen Step 5 4 Find its IMEI. Scroll down the About section, and right along the middle of the screen, you ll find the IMEI label with its code listed right beside it. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 5 5 Write down and make a copy of the codes listed in this field. Advertisement

Image titled Use iPhone Headphones Step 2 1 Open the dial keypad. From the Springboard of your iPhone, tap the app with a green phone icon labeled Phone at the bottom of the screen to access its call screen. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 7 2 Tap om the "Keypad" option in the lower right side of the screen. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 8 3 Dial *#06#. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 9 4 Press the green Call button to start calling this code. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 10 5 Take note of the IMEI. Once you ve pressed the Call key, a set of numerical codes will appear on your iPhone s screen this is its unique IMEI code. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 11 6 Write down and make a copy of the codes displayed on the call screen. Image titled Check the IMEI Number of an iPhone Step 12 7 Tap the "Dismiss" button to return into the Keypad screen. Advertisement
